message_1:
A travelling salesman has to visit 5 cities. The distance between each pair of cities is given below: 

| Cities | City 1 | City 2 | City 3 | City 4 | City 5 |
|--------|--------|--------|--------|--------|--------|
| City 1 |   0    |   10   |   20   |   35   |   25   |
| City 2 |   10   |   0    |   15   |   30   |   20   |
| City 3 |   20   |   15   |   0    |   45   |   30   |
| City 4 |   35   |   30   |   45   |   0    |   10   |
| City 5 |   25   |   20   |   30   |   10   |   0    |

What is the shortest possible route that the salesman can take to visit all the cities exactly once and return to the starting city?
